title: If a substance is denser than water, will it sink or float? - Quora

Whether the substance will sink or float depends on density and the volume of the water that it displaces (pl. see Archimedes’ principle). So, a ball of steel would sink (steel being about 7.8 times denser than water), but a boat or barge made of steel would float because it has much larger surface area and displaces more water. Oils are generally lighter than water and hence would float. Wood is generally less dense than water and would float.
